Goal: Assess ability to set long-term direction
Signals: Vision clarity, market insight, business acumen
Strong Answer: Connects to mission, anticipates shifts, quantifies opportunity
IC5/IC6 Example: We should build X because users asked
IC7/D1 Example: X is a $200M opportunity defending core business...

Strong Answer: Segments users, identifies JTBD, prioritizes with logic

IC7/D1 Example: Core JTBD is Y. Segment A values speed. Prioritizing A (70% rev)...

Goal: Assess ability to ship through ambiguity
Signals: Operational rigor, XFN leadership, tradeoff judgment
Weak Answer: Generic process, takes vague credit, blames others
Strong Answer: Owns hard tradeoffs, specific XFN tactics, quantifies impact
IC5/IC6 Example: Wrote PRD and shipped on time
IC7/D1 Example: 3 weeks late. De-scoped Y (10% value). Got Legal aligned. Shipped early.

Strong Answer: Articulates tradeoffs (CAP), understands cost, proposed phases

Goal: Assess data-driven decision making
Weak Answer: Vanity metrics, takes number at face value
Strong Answer: North star + guardrails, synthesizes conflicting signals
IC5/IC6 Example: Measure DAU and retention
IC7/D1 Example: NS: Weekly active creators. Guardrail: D7 retention. 5% holdback.

Goal: Assess data-driven decision making
Weak Answer: Ignores negative signal to 'win' the launch
Strong Answer: Weighs long-term health vs short-term gain
IC5/IC6 Example: Launch because clicks are up
IC7/D1 Example: Clicks up 5% but latency up 200ms. I'd hold launch because latency kills ecosystem health long-term.

Goal: Assess ability to build and scale teams
Signals: Hiring bar, org design, conflict resolution
Strong Answer: Explains team topology, hiring calibration, stakeholder framing
IC5/IC6 Example: Hired A-players, worked with Eng
IC7/D1 Example: Re-org'd to pods. Cut coordination overhead 30%. Handled underperformer.
